channel.title: The Courtyard on
channel.description: Recent content in The Courtyard on

item.title: AI is a collage
item.description: Thinking of deep learning models as a collage Dada, Instagram, and the Future of AI/ Interesting points about how snapchat / its clones are the modern version of Dada many things are a collage today - video edits, hip hop samples, photoshops consumer + creator combined GANs are the ultimate form of this (generator is the creator, discriminator is the consumer) AI generated images are kind of like a super collage of thousands of images Neural nets are just linear combinations AI and Democracy “Education is a founding principle of democracy, because a democracy is only as good as its voters, just as any algorithm is only as good as its data.

item.title: Building your village
item.description: [unplanned-repeated-interactions](notes/Unplanned repeated interactions)

item.title: Collector's fallacy
item.description: Collector’s fallacy Collector’s fallacy: you really have to work with something to understand it. Knowing about a thing is not the same thing as knowing it.

item.title: Creating to inspire creation
item.description: My main goal in making things is to inspire others to make things, potentially in new ways. Maybe someone will see my paintings and think, “I want to learn how to paint like that!

item.title: Doing quests is more rewarding than grinding skills
item.description: When playing MMORPGs, there are two main ways of leveling up: doing quests and grinding skills. Generally quests and grinding line up to some degree, but not in RuneScape.

item.title: Gradient of improvement
item.description: In mathematics, a gradient is a vector pointing in the direction of the steepest descent/ascent. The magnitude of the vector is how steep the slope is, and so the gradient is the vector with the largest magnitude, or in other words the largest change.

item.title: High skill ceiling
item.description: High skill ceilings allow for skill expression

item.title: High skill ceilings allow for skill expression
Human labor is hidden behind AI
item.description: Human labor is hidden behind AI Ghost work Automation won’t replace human labor; it will just split what humans currently do into tons of tiny edge cases that pay a few cents apiece, small enough that handling it won’t count as a “real” job and the wealthy class will never see it happen.

item.title: Learning exhaust
item.description: learning exhaust Select quotes from https://www.swyx.io/learn-in-public/ make the thing you wish you had found when you were learning Wear your noobyness on your sleeve.

item.title: Living a unique life to help humanity forward
Low rank approximation
item.description: Everyday examples Human intuition Vertical slice Spitpaint Skill scaffolding

item.title: Low rank approximation of an orchestra
item.description: Different sizes of music groups can be imagined as a ( low rank approximation of a full sound. Imagine a full symphony orchestra, with 100 members.

item.title: Memorization as a skill scaffolding
item.description: Why you should do flashcards / spaced repetition not to memorize just to memorize, but memorize so that when you see stuff, you can RECOGNIZE and UNDERSTAND it in context - which has a way bigger effect for learning

item.title: MMO mechanics are glue work
item.description: Doing mechanics In MMORPG raid encounters, a group of adventurers will get together to clear a dungeon or boss encounter. Each of these adventurers will have their own specialized role in the team; a tank that gets the attention of the boss and protects the party, damage dealers who try to down the boss as fast as possible, and supportive healers who try to keep everyone else alive.

item.title: Overcoming blank canvas syndrome
item.description: Happy accidents

item.title: Requirements for a real-life quest
item.description: Requirements Starts by talking to a person Has set of pre-requisite skills Ends with talking to a person Other potential characteristics: May have some type of reward Generally gives experience in some skill(s) during the process Might open up to future quests with the people you met on it

item.title: Shortcomings of intention
item.description: Shortcomings of intention intention is WHAT someone is thinking when they do an action. for example, i say somethng to you with the intent of starting conversation.

item.title: Some communities lend themselves to teaching and mentorship
item.description: Some communities lend themselves towards teaching and mentorship generally hobby communities are better about this than “professional” communities e.

item.title: Startups are asymmetrical warfare
item.description: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Skirmisher Skirmishers' open formations and smaller numbers can give them superior mobility over the regular forces, allowing them to engage only on favorable terms, taking advantage of better position or terrain, and quickly withdrawing from any threat of superior enemy forces.

item.title: Using depth models to generate post-processing fog
item.description: With neural networks it’s now possible to generate a depth map from any image. I noticed that generated depth maps often look like the image on an extremely foggy day (almost like a demo of atmospheric perspective)

item.title: Vertical slice
item.description: A vertical slice is a type of MVP in the world of game development, in which the game is fully playable and includes all the necessary features to function as a game.
